channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Pause on U.S. Funding Spreads Fear of H.I.V. Spike Across Africa
item.description: Patients and health care advocates said the abrupt decision to halt U.S. funding for a lifesaving H.I.V. program led to widespread confusion. The back...

item.title: Former Sen. Bob Menendez sentenced to 11 years for taking bribes of gold bars and cash and acting as agent for Egypt
item.description: The Democrat resigned last year after becoming one of only a handful of U.S. senators ever convicted while in office.

item.title: Shell and Equinor Oil and Gas Production Is Blocked at Sites Off British Coast
item.description: A court ruling requires the British government to consider the potential climate impact of the oil and gas produced in the North Sea.

item.title: Trump Calls Canada a Big Player in the Fentanyl Trade. Is It?
item.description: President Trump has threatened to impose tariffs on Canada over drug trafficking, equating it with Mexico. U.S. government reports do not support the ...

item.title: Starbucks is slashing 30% of its offerings because CEO Brian Niccol says its menu has become ‘overly complex’
item.description: Niccol said the company made progress on its “Back to Starbucks” plan in the first quarter.

item.title: Salwan Momika, Who Burned a Quran in Sweden, Is Killed
item.description: Salwan Momika, an Iraqi immigrant in Sweden, set off enormous protests when he burned a Quran in 2023. He had been scheduled to appear in court on Thu...

item.title: A Plane Crash Near Washington, and 3 Contentious Senate Hearings
Everything we know so far about the American Airlines jet that crashed into a Black Hawk helicopter
item.description: Rescue craft are in the Potomac River below the site of the collision with D.C. fire chief John Donnelly saying "we don't know" if there are any survi...

item.title: Deutsche Bank reports steep profit drop after splashing $1.7 billion on Postbank legal costs
item.description: Germany's biggest lender was hit by legal costs related to a troubled takeover, resulting in weak earnings.

item.title: With Sweeping Executive Orders, Trump Tests Local Control of Schools
item.description: The orders seek to encourage “patriotic education” and restrict discussions about racism and gender by threatening to withdraw federal funding. But sc...

item.title: What Israel’s UNRWA Ban Could Mean for Palestinians
item.description: Legislation that goes into effect on Thursday bars UNRWA from operating in the country. That will affect aid delivery to Gaza and beyond.

item.title: Thai Families Wait in Anxious Hope for Gaza Hostage Release
item.description: Five families hoped that their loved ones were finally being released from Gaza after 15 months as hostages.

item.title: Trump wants to use Guantanamo Bay to hold the ‘worst of the worst’ detained in immigrant sweeps—here’s what to know about the Cuba outpost
item.description: While the U.S. naval base in Cuba is best known for the suspects brought in after the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks, it has a separate facility used for dec...

item.title: What Israel’s UNRWA Ban Could Mean for Palestinians
item.description: Legislation that goes into effect on Thursday bars UNRWA from operating in the country. That will affect aid delivery to Gaza and beyond.
